body_html:
@drpngx Yes the issue still exists; tfcompile still requires at least one feed. Way back in July 2017 I had tried to make a quick change to remove this requirement, but it was more complicated than I had time for, so I didn't pursue it further.

This should be a rare use-case, and there's a workaround by passing in a dummy feed for some part of your computation. I'll mark contributions welcome in case anyone wants to take a shot at it.

This should be a rare use-case, and there's a workaround by passing in a dummy feed for some part of your computation.  I'll mark contributions welcome in case anyone wants to take a shot at it.
body:
@drpngx Yes the issue still exists; tfcompile still requires at least one feed.  Way back in July 2017 I had tried to make a quick change to remove this requirement, but it was more complicated than I had time for, so I didn't pursue it further.

This should be a rare use-case, and there's a workaround by passing in a dummy feed for some part of your computation.  I'll mark contributions welcome in case anyone wants to take a shot at it.
